description:
In this world, cats aren't furry four-footed creatures, but human-like girls with ears, tails, and cat-like behaviors. Still kept as pets, they're allowed out on their own if they pass a special training and wear their bells. A young man running his own patisserie lives with two of these cats, Chocola and Vanilla, who help him out around the store. Maple and Cinnamon, two of the cats from home, also come in everyday, and together they enjoy a sweet life. Even if the cats don't always get along – and Azuki and Coconut certainly don't – things are peaceful and calm until a stray kitten follows Chocola home.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sayori_nw?s=09) | [pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/104409)

Sayori, previously known as Amanita, is a Chinese-born Japanese mangaka, illustrator and eroge producer. She is the representative of the doujin circle NEKO WORKs, best known for creating the *Nekopara* series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Website](https://highkick.jp/tateyama)

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.

[Profile (Style Cube)](http://stylecube.jp/talents/miku/index.html) | [Profile (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/itomiku/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/itou-miku/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/InfoItomiku) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/itomiku_official/) | [LINE](https://page.line.me/itomiku_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miku_Itō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤美来)

Miku joined the idol unit [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177) on April 27, 2013 and is one half of its subunit, [Pyxis](https://anilist.co/staff/139753), along with [Moe Toyota](https://anilist.co/staff/118398). 

Miku's hobbies include watching anime, dancing, and playing Hyakunin Isshu. She also practices kendo (but is at the lowest level) and enjoys acting. She is a fan of Kamen Rider, and her favorite rider is Den-O.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Fu Xuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
• Olivia - Memento Mori (VG)
• Kolulu - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
• Indomitable - Azur Lane (VG)
• Liv - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
• Agnès Claudel - Kiseki Series (VG)

__Nicknames:__ Koyuki (こゆき), Yagi-chan (やぎちゃん)

[Profile (Production ACE)](https://www.production-ace.co.jp/ace_talent/yukiyagi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/meeeyuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/八木侑紀)

__Height:__ 155 cm 

[Profile (EARLY WING)](http://earlywing.co.jp/talent_w/izawashiori.html) | [Blog](http://piyorivoice.blog64.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shiori_izawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shiori_izawa0201/)

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Marco in "Marco & The Galaxy Dragon" (VG) (Japanese)
- Diona in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Moe Kazekura in "Blue Archive" (VG)
Tomomi Umetsu is a Japanese director, episode director and editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Website](http://www.hitenkei.net/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/HitenKei) | [Pixiv](http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=490219) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hitenkei/) | [Tumblr](https://hitenkei.tumblr.com/)

Hiten is an artist that comes from Taiwan. They are currently living in Tokyo, Japan. Married to fellow illustrator [Tadano Yukiko](https://anilist.co/staff/263208/Tadano-Yukiko).
